alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Lewis; Oswego (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 02 at 9:47PM EST until February 02 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1000 PM EST FOR SOUTHEASTERN JEFFERSON...LEWIS AND OSWEGO COUNTIES... At 946 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from Piercefield to 8 miles southwest of Redfield, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes Interstate 81 between exits 32 and 38. Locations impacted include... Fulton, Carthage, Lowville, Pulaski, West Carthage, Central Square, Redfield, Selkirk Shores State Park, Highmarket and Mexico Point State Park. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents.
